caption.p: The three patterns of ecological niche models (ENMs) and distribution dynamics for birds studied in the present study. ( a) Aegithalos concinnus, ( b) Yuhina diademata and ( c) Spizixos semitorques. For each species, three time points were considered, i.e., the present day (Present), last glacial maximum (LGM; ~26–19 thousand years ago, Ka), and last interglacial period (LIG; ~112–132 Ka). Black dots show species occurrence records rarefied at a 1-km spatial resolution. To avoid over-prediction, the ENMs were transformed to binary (presence/ absence) distribution by a threshold of the maximum training sensitivity plus specificity (MTSS), with detailed logistic values specified in Additional file 1: Table S3
